intro: Cybianthus panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
